question_text: What is the primary reason computer manufacturers ship systems with two 16GB memory modules instead of one 32GB module?
answer_options: Two modules cost less than one larger module
Two modules enable dual-channel memory operation for better performance
One large module would overheat the system
Two modules provide automatic backup if one fails
correct_answer: Two modules enable dual-channel memory operation for better performance
explanation: Using two identical modules allows the motherboard to operate in dual-channel mode, doubling memory bandwidth compared to single-channel operation.
